treatment.description: Plants crown-forming (some-times suckering or rhizomatous when injured); twigs of current season ± terete, smooth, hairy in lines. Leaf blades green, elliptic or ovate to oblong-lanceolate, 40–70 × 15–30 mm, mem-branous, margins serrulate, abaxial surface glandular-hairy. Inflorescence bracts caducous, 2, basal. Pedicels nodding, to 1.5 cm, glabrous. Flowers: calyx lobes to 1 mm, glabrous; corolla deeply reflexed, white, pink, or rarely red; filaments pilose. Berries red, deep purple, or black, 6–15 mm diam., glabrous. 2n = 24.
treatment.habitat: Wooded slopes, subalpine shrub lands, boggy areas, rocky slopes and thickets
treatment.description: Shrubs, procumbent to erect, (0.3–)1.2–4(–9) dm, rhizomatous. Leaves deciduous. Inflorescences axillary, racemes, 2–4-flowered, sometimes flowers solitary, ebracteate, from scaly bud on previous year’s wood. Pedicels ± articulated with calyx tube. Flowers: sepals 4–5; petals 4–5(–6), connate for 3/4 to nearly their entire lengths, corolla urceolate; stamens usually 8, included; anthers with awns, tubules ca. 1 mm. Berries 4–5-locular. Seeds ca. 8–15.
